DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Studying sample blood laboratory patient receive chemotherapy may help doctor learn effect chemotherapy cell . It may also help doctor understand patient respond treatment . PURPOSE : This research study study biomarkers related thrombosis patient newly diagnose multiple myeloma receive chemotherapy .
DOC.brief_title: Biomarkers Related Thrombosis Patients With Newly Diagnosed Multiple Myeloma Receiving Chemotherapy
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - To measure level circulate tissue factor ( TF ) patient newly diagnose multiple myeloma several time point , , administration chemotherapy and/or antiangiogenic agent . Secondary - To measure correlation TF two marker coagulation activation ( i.e. , D-dimer , thrombin-antithrombin [ TAT ] complex ) two marker endothelial activation ( i.e. , soluble E-selectin , soluble thrombomodulin ) patient . - To measure compare ( descriptively ) microparticle-associated TF procoagulant activity assay two assay use sample patient . OUTLINE : Patients undergo blood sample collection baseline periodically treatment . Circulating tissue factor ( TF ) activity level coagulation endothelial activation ( ELISA ) measure . Medical chart review sociodemographic medical information . After completion study , patient follow 3 month .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Newly diagnose ; relapse , refractory multiple myeloma PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Central venous access device allow Recruited Division Hematology/Oncology Lineberger Comprehensive Cancer Center University North Carolina No history venous thromboembolism No hospitalization > 2 day within past month Not pregnant No patient refuse deem unsuitable chemotherapy PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : No surgery within past month Bone marrow biopsy , central venous line placement diagnostic biopsy surgery fineneedle aspiration allow * No concurrent anticoagulation therapy Concurrent antiplatelet agent , aspirin and/or clopidogrel , allow
